channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: What to know about names such as Operation Charlotte's Web
item.description: There is renewed criticism over the names of military and DHS operations, including the most recent, Operation Charlotte's Web.
item.content:encoded:
There is renewed criticism over the names of military and DHS operations, including the most recent, Operation Charlotte's Web.

(Image credit: Jeon Heon-Kyun/Pool)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: Hundreds of National Guard troops will leave Portland and Chicago
item.description: The decision by the Defense Department comes as Guard deployments in Chicago and Portland have been stalled for weeks by the courts.
item.content:encoded:
The decision by the Defense Department comes as Guard deployments in Chicago and Portland have been stalled for weeks by the courts.

(Image credit: Kamil Krzaczynski)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: The USS Gerald R. Ford aircraft carrier is in the Caribbean. Here's its backstory
item.description: It was deployed to support Operation Southern Spear. The ship is the first of a new class of aircraft carriers being built for the U.S. military.
item.content:encoded:
It was deployed to support Operation Southern Spear. The ship is the first of a new class of aircraft carriers being built for the U.S. military.

(Image credit: U.S. Navy)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: Tornado survivors in St. Louis say recovery is a mess, due to FEMA changes
item.description: Six months after the St. Louis tornado, residents say Trump's new disaster policy has left them on their own.
item.content:encoded: Six months after the St. Louis tornado, residents say Trump's new disaster policy has left them on their own.
item.dc:creator: Sacha Pfeiffer

item.title: Marjorie Taylor Greene says Trump policies are 'not America first' in fight over MAGA
item.description: Trump called Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene, R-Ga., a "traitor" after his revoking political endorsement of her. Greene said Sunday his words can "put my life in danger."
item.content:encoded:
Trump called Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene, R-Ga., a "traitor" after his revoking political endorsement of her. Greene said Sunday his words can "put my life in danger."

(Image credit: Alex Brandon)
item.dc:creator: Luke Garrett

item.title: Your artificial Christmas tree will cost more this year, thanks in part to tariffs
item.description: If you're planning on buying an artificial Christmas tree this year, you may want to make your purchase sooner rather than later.
item.content:encoded:
If you're planning on buying an artificial Christmas tree this year, you may want to make your purchase sooner rather than later.

(Image credit: Elaine Thompson)
item.dc:creator: Ayesha Rascoe

item.title: 'We have no choice': Indigenous guards take on cocaine gangs in Peru's Amazon
item.description: Deep in the Peruvian Amazon, the Kakataibo Indigenous Guard patrols their ancestral land armed with spears, machetes and a drone — risking their lives to keep cocaine producers out of the forest.
item.content:encoded:
Deep in the Peruvian Amazon, the Kakataibo Indigenous Guard patrols their ancestral land armed with spears, machetes and a drone — risking their lives to keep cocaine producers out of the forest.

(Image credit: Simeon Tegel for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Simeon Tegel

item.title: Iran's foreign minister says the nation is no longer enriching uranium at any site in the country
item.description: Iran's foreign minister on Sunday said that Tehran is no longer enriching uranium at any site in the country.
item.content:encoded:
Iran's foreign minister on Sunday said that Tehran is no longer enriching uranium at any site in the country.

(Image credit: Vahid Salemi)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Hundreds of thousands rally in Manila against flood-control corruption scandal
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of Filipinos gathered Sunday in the capital in the largest rally so far to demand accountability for a flood-control corruption scandal that has implicated powerful members of Congress and top government officials.
item.content:encoded:
Hundreds of thousands of Filipinos gathered Sunday in the capital in the largest rally so far to demand accountability for a flood-control corruption scandal that has implicated powerful members of Congress and top government officials.

(Image credit: Mark Cristino)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: How do you find peace after war? A combat vet and NPR reporter's bond points a way
item.description: NPR Veterans Correspondent Quil Lawrence interviewed Dave Carlson over 10 years, as the Iraq war vet went from war to incarceration to redemption on his long journey home.
item.content:encoded:
NPR Veterans Correspondent Quil Lawrence interviewed Dave Carlson over 10 years, as the Iraq war vet went from war to incarceration to redemption on his long journey home.

(Image credit: Caroline Yang for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Quil Lawrence
